Headline: Vice President Operations | Chief Operating Officer ‚û• Luxury E-Commerce Leadership | Marketplace Growth & Global Expansion | Customer Experience Transformation | P&L & Operational Excellence
Comment:
The funding spree distorted priorities, pushing unsustainable growth while creating unnecessary panic among businesses built on strong fundamentals. Companies that focused on unit economics and profitability were often overlooked in the rush for scale at any cost.

Now, as the funding climate shifts, disciplined businesses are proving their resilience. The real winners are not those who raised the most, but those who built to last. Growth is essential, but without profitability, it‚Äôs just a delayed reckoning.

Headline: Co-Founder & CEO @Jaagruk Bharat | Building Bharat‚Äôs Trusted Helpdesk | IITKGP
Comment:
Absolutely agree with this. The narrative has definitely shifted ‚Äî and rightfully so.

Just last week, I met with an investor, and during our conversation, we landed on an interesting point: Jaagruk Bharat might actually be self-sustainable in a few months. Their response? ‚ÄúThen why would you even need external capital?‚Äù

And honestly, that made me pause.
There‚Äôs a fine line between becoming self-sustaining and truly profitable ‚Äî and for us, that line is all about deepening user experience, delivering more value, and building a product customers genuinely love and return to.
For companies like ours, funding should be a catalyst ‚Äî not a crutch. It's not about chasing valuations; it's about creating value.
